hook.text: Students who sleep after studying outperform those who stay up cramming. Sleep is a memory tool.

buildup.text: During sleep, the brain replays the day's experiences and transfers them from short-term to long-term storage.

discovery.text: Slow-wave sleep consolidates facts and events. REM sleep processes emotions and creative connections.

twist.text: All-night study sessions actually impair memory. The brain needs sleep to finish what learning started.

climax.text: Sleep isn't downtime for the brain. It's when memory consolidation does its most critical work.

punchline.text: Sleep doesn't pause learning. It completes it.

quiz.question: What happens to memories during sleep?
options: They are consolidated from short-term to long-term storage
They are transferred to the spinal cord
